abstract_ssm: The Decker family papers span the period 1815 to 1932 (bulk dates from 1815 to 1895) and consists of correspondence spanning the years 1815 to 1878; two scrapbooks (dated 1870 and 1895); an autograph book compiled by Josie Ray Decker, 1884 to 1893; certificates awarded to Dr. Ray; a cookbook published by the Huntington Methodist Episcopal Church, 1899; Dr. Ray's handwritten medical notebook (containing entries regarding the treatment of various diseases and medical conditions; instructions on the preparation of drugs and remedies and dosage are included); genealogical notes; and two family genealogies (Wood family record, printed, with marginal notes; handwritten Ray family record).
geogname_ssm: New York (N.Y.) |x Social life and customs |y 19th century

place_sim: New York (N.Y.) -- Social life and customs -- 19th century
